preferences.main_subtitle_text: Notification from the Endpoint Management Team
preferences.paragraph1_text: Your Mac is behind on macOS updates.
preferences.paragraph2_text: The Endpoint Management team will be upgrading all Macs automatically to the newest version of macOS Catalina on November 15th. However, it is recommended you pick a time yourself to perform the upgrade before this date, to minimize any work disruptions. The longest these upgrade should take is about 45 minutes. If you're on a notebook, please leave it plugged into power, with the lid open for the duration.
preferences.paragraph3_text: To begin the process, simply click on the button below to open Software Center and choose Upgrade to Catalina. Note that macOS Catalina removes support for 32-bit applications. You can click the Run 32-bit App Report Policy in Software Center to see what applications you have that are 32-bit. These applications should be updated or replaced if possible. You can also request an exception to be allowed to stay on macOS Mojave (also in Software Center).
